{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3287854,"name":"Nathan Manhardt","username":"Xolverr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xolverr/{size}/211198_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T15:34:42.075Z","cooked":"

P: if you‚Äôre not where you want to be, get there.
I: if you haven‚Äôt been where you want to be for a long time, get there faster
D: if you‚Äôre getting close to where you want to be, slow down.

(found in the description of this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qKy98Cbcltw)

Can confirm. Great description. Much better than my description of Derivative. ‚ÄúSlope-i-ness/slopiness‚Äù. As in how much will the slope be adjusted as it nears the setpoint. I like this though.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T15:39:49.000Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":886,"readers_count":885,"score":212.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":32004,"username":"dan","name":"Dan Katzuv","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60828,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3287871,"name":"Jim Barstow","username":"JimB1918","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T15:49:03.398Z","cooked":"
Xolverr:

P: if you‚Äôre not where you want to be, get there.
I: if you haven‚Äôt been where you want to be for a long time, get there faster
D: if you‚Äôre getting close to where you want to be, slow down.

for (I)ntegral, I prefer a more pedantic ‚ÄúIf you haven‚Äôt been where you want to be for a while, apply more effort to get there‚Äù, since it really isn‚Äôt about speed.

Also, a relatively important one that I only recently came to fully understand is ‚ÄúIZone: If you are really far from where you want to be, don‚Äôt start applying more effort to get there until you are within this margin‚Äù

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T15:49:03.398Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":12,"reads":817,"readers_count":816,"score":298.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Jim Barstow","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51835,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/6","custom_user_title":"M(Code, Elec), CSA/FTAA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288189,"name":"usbcd36","username":"usbcd36","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/usbcd36/{size}/2444_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T20:06:00.788Z","cooked":"

One of the most informative experiences I had with PID was setting up a small motor, gearbox, encoder, and wheel, and setting it up for position control. The setpoint was on the throttle of a joystick, and the motor was weak enough that I could grab the wheel and force it to a different angle. For the most part, I left the setpoint constant and tried to manipulate the wheel.

Proportional felt like an imaginary spring, dragging the position of the wheel toward the setpoint. Greater kP, stiffer spring.

Derivative felt like trying to drag my hand through water quickly, vs. slowly, like being in a swimming pool. It was trying to keep the wheel from moving quickly. Greater kD, more viscous liquid.

Integral felt like a friend was holding onto the other end of that shaft and was trying to mess with me. The feeling didn‚Äôt resemble any physical system I knew of. Also, it conveyed a feeling of impatience.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T20:06:00.788Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":643,"readers_count":642,"score":288.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"usbcd36","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7334,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288314,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T21:51:11.904Z","cooked":"

This past fall I was an FLL Challenge mentor with a team comprised specifically of 8 year old third graders, and decided to teach them PID control so they can use it in their robot. In order to help them remember what all the components of PID do, they created a skit, each student representing themselves as ‚ÄúP‚Äù, ‚ÄúI‚Äù, and ‚ÄúD‚Äù.

In the skit, they proclaimed:
‚ÄúI‚Äôm P, I‚Äôm pretty far away, so I better speed up!‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm I, it‚Äôs taking too long to get there, I better speed up!‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm D, I‚Äôm getting close and going too fast, better put on the brakes!‚Äù

It was a pretty funny skit!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T21:51:11.904Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":516,"readers_count":515,"score":318.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":12},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":15,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288319,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T21:52:50.387Z","cooked":"

The school house rock song we needed but never got. PID, that‚Äôs what happening. Only reason many people in my generation know what the heck a bill is. I could see the song tempo getting faster and slower to emphasize the points and how they affect the song over time

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T21:54:11.636Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":474,"readers_count":473,"score":169.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6078,"username":"seg9585","name":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/9","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288372,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T22:49:06.675Z","cooked":"
Xolverr:

D: if you‚Äôre getting close to where you want to be, slow down.

Only if ‚Äúwhere you want to be‚Äù isn‚Äôt moving!

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T22:49:06.675Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":433,"readers_count":432,"score":126.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/10","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288373,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T22:50:50.833Z","cooked":"

Isn‚Äôt moving while you try to get there. After that it can move all it wants.

Edit: If the setpoint is constantly moving before you actually get there the derivative can do weird things. Think like velocity control of a shooter as opposed to a setpoint position. If you are constantly changing the target RPM setpoint it will create weird output changes. If it‚Äôs a position it can move once you are close again, as long as the setpoint is mostly static while trying to get there.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T22:53:44.236Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":397,"readers_count":396,"score":89.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/11","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"question","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288381,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T22:55:54.456Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm not sure what you mean by ‚Äúweird things‚Äù - it does exactly what it is supposed to, which is try to match the system‚Äôs derivative to the derivative of the the setpoint. Whether the derivative term speeds you up or slows you down depends on whether you‚Äôre leading or lagging the commanded motion.

It‚Äôs the job of an external motion profiler or input filter to ensure that the sequence of setpoints given to the feedback loop is reasonable.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T22:56:52.045Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":373,"readers_count":372,"score":79.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20632,"username":"kingc95","name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/12","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288389,"name":"","username":"Hollisms","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T23:03:01.974Z","cooked":"

‚ÄúI‚Äù is evil and should be kept in a cage and only allowed to play with others with extreme caution. And even then it is best kept on a leash. (I zone, etc.)

And by the way it should be PDI‚Ä¶.

Hollisms:

And by the way it should be PDI‚Ä¶.

Can we just call it ‚Äúlinear feedback?‚Äù

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T23:03:32.754Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":72.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/14","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288432,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-19T00:08:48.479Z","cooked":"
Oblarg:

Only if ‚Äúwhere you want to be‚Äù isn‚Äôt moving!

Not necessarily, when passing a police officer on the freeway, you hit the brakes to match your velocity to the speed limit, not to stop completely

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-19T00:08:48.479Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":314,"readers_count":313,"score":67.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288454,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-19T00:47:07.672Z","cooked":"
usbcd36:

Proportional felt like an imaginary spring,

For position-targeted PID, precisely. The physics model used for this is a spring which is balanced at the set point.

usbcd36:

Derivative felt like trying to drag my hand through water

Again, right on. The physics model is a dashpot, which is basically the same thing as a car‚Äôs shock absorber, a piston moving through a viscous fluid.

usbcd36:

Integral ‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt resemble any physical system I knew of.

Again, that‚Äôs right. I has a memory of its previous state which directly affects its behavior, and while there are physical systems with this attribute, they are usually engineered rather than naturally occurring.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-19T00:48:01.793Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":298,"readers_count":297,"score":139.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Gus Michel II","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú "},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/16","custom_user_title":"Somebody Else ‚¨õüü´üü•üüßüü®üü©üü¶üü™‚ñí‚ñí‚¨ú ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288460,"name":"Eric Ward","username":"bathtubed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bathtubed/{size}/220364_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-19T00:57:17.597Z","cooked":"

Velocity-targeted PID is where you can gain intuition on Integral control.
The integral of velocity error is displacement, so Integral control effectively is trying to ‚Äúcatch up‚Äù to where it should‚Äôve been had it achieved its constant velocity.

You could consider modifying this experiment to have velocity control move the wheel very slowly at a constant rate.
When you try to slow it down, you should see it attempt to speed past the desired velocity until it catches up to where it would‚Äôve been had you not slowed it.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-19T00:57:17.597Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":281,"readers_count":280,"score":61.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"Eric Ward","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22335,"username":"GeeTwo","name":"Gus Michel II","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35208,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3637 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/17","custom_user_title":"3637 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288464,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-19T00:58:45.736Z","cooked":"

I is not inherently evil, its just that FRC teams tend to saturate their inputs which causes windup. If teams implemented clamping/conditional integration, there wouldn‚Äôt be very many windup issues at all. In fact, with correctly implemented anti-windup, you can run quite a lot of I without any overshoot to be seen.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-19T00:58:45.736Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":278,"readers_count":277,"score":70.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":36169,"username":"Hollisms","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/18","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288543,"name":"","username":"Wesley","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wesley/{size}/155134_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-19T02:25:54.354Z","cooked":"

Does proper anti-windup mean zeroing out the accumulator when the error is too large, or just leaving the accumulator alone, applying its effect without adding to it?

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":36,"updated_at":"2024-01-19T02:25:54.354Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":60.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":450811,"topic_slug":"finally-i-understand-pid","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50219,"username":"Alex_Y","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48578,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"95's programming team from 2021 to 2024"},"post_url":"/t/finally-i-understand-pid/450811/19","custom_user_title":"95's programming team from 2021 to 2024","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288551,"name":"Kyle Reeve","username":"kreeve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kreeve/{size}/187015_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-19T02:38:01.547Z","cooked":"

One way is to apply a gain K_{aw} to u - u_{sat} (where the saturated output u_{sat} is the output of your controller clamped to within a valid range like -1 to 1), and subtract that from the integral term to prevent it from growing when there‚Äôs saturation. So the formula for integral term goes from I(t) = \int e(t)dt to I(t) = \int (e(t) + K_{aw} (u - u_{sat}))dt, and then u = k_p e(t) + k_i I(t) + k_D \dot{e} . As an example, if your PID outputs 1.5 as a control effort, then u_{sat} = 1.0 so u - u_{sat} is negative, thus you prevent the integral term from growing too much when the controller is saturated.
